com.yantra.api.vas

Interface allocateWorkOrder

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.VASApi, YIFApi

    public interface allocateWorkOrder

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document allocateWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      allocateWorkOrder allocates the unallocated requested quantity (QuantityRequested - QuantityAllocated) for the work order and updates the QuantityAllocated on the work order.

    • Method Detail

      • allocateWorkOrder

        org.w3c.dom.Document allocateWorkOrder(YFSEnvironment env,
                                       org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                                throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                       java.rmi.RemoteException
        allocateWorkOrder allocates the unallocated requested quantity (QuantityRequested - QuantityAllocated) for the work order and updates the QuantityAllocated on the work order.

        While allocating for the work order, the demand type used in the inventory availability calculations corresponds to the AllocationDemandTypeForConsumed of YFS_Work_Order_Alloc_Cons table. For the quantity allocated the supply type - SupplyTypeForCreated and demand type - DemandTypeForConsumed that are placed while creating the work order will be moved to the supply type - AllocationSupplyTypeForCreated and demand type - AllocationDemandTypeForConsumed for the values in the YFS_Work_Order_Alloc_Cons table. Allocation is not done for any components, but a WIP supply will be created for the parent.

        While doing allocate work order, it looks for AllocationRuleId as SYSTEM.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMGetItemDetailsUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalInventoryForItemListUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetExternalInventoryUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetAvailabilityCorrectionsUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetExternalSupplyUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetSupplyCorrectionsUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.INVGetDemandCorrectionsUE
        com.yantra.ycp.japi.ue.YCPGetNodeMinimumNotificationTimeUE
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.ue.YFSGetAvailabilityCorrectionsForItemListUE
        com.yantra.vas.japi.ue.VASConfirmAssignmentsForWorkOrderAllocationUE

        Events Raised:
        Raised under the transaction ALLOCATE_WORK_ORDER
          ON_SUCCESS:
            This event is raised upon successful execution of allocateWorkOrder API.
            Data published - VAS_ALLOCATE_WORK_ORDER.ON_SUCCESS.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt

          ALLOCATION_COMPLETE:
            This event is raised when the work order is allocated completely.
            Data published - VAS_ALLOCATE_WORK_ORDER.ALLOCATION_COMPLETE.xml
            Key data - workOrder_dbd.txt

        Template Support: Yes.

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions: None

        Output Template Support: Yes

        Database Extensibility Support:
        Supported for all the elements except:

          Status
          WorkOrderComponent
          WorkOrderActivity
          WorkOrderActivityDtl
          PersonInfo

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains details about the work order allocated. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.

        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
